alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hamilton; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Marion, eastern Boone and southwestern Hamilton Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 523 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lebanon, or 15 miles southeast of Frankfort, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Zionsville around 535 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Carmel and Indianapolis. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 134 and 143. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central Indiana.
